flawed_nl_solution:
If Isabella has $15 more than Giselle, she has $120+$15 = $132
Combined, Isabella and Giselle has $132+$120=$<<132+120=252>>252
Isabella has $45 more than Sam, meaning Sam has $132-$45=$87
Together, Sam, Isabella, and Giselle has $252+$87=$<<252+87=339>>339
if they donate the money to 3 shoppers at their local town's supermarket who then decides to share it equally, each shopper will receive $339/3=$<<339/3=113>>113
#### 113

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 135, not 132. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
